description:
1/25/2023 – at around 7:04 a.m. at the intersection of NE Cornelius Pass Road and NE Ronler Drive .  
 This crash involved a vehicle versus a n electric bicyclist with no to minor  injuries.  
 Weather was clear and the pavement surface was dry . 
 The vehicle was stopped  eastbound on NE Ronler Drive. Driver pulled forward on green light to 
proceed with right turn to travel southbound when they struck the electric bicyclis t. Electric bicyclist 
 was travelling north on the west side sidewalk of NE Cornelius Pass Road.  Bicyclist was unaware of the 
cycle track on east side of Cornelius Pass Road. Independent witness stated driver had green light and 
bicyclist rode directly in front of driver.  
 Bicyclist was cited for not obeying crosswalk traffic control device.

1/25/2023 – at around 6:37 p.m. at the intersection of S E 10
th Avenue and SE Maple Street . 
 
This crash involved a vehicle versus a pedestrian. Pedestrian reported minor injuries.  
 
Weather was clear and the pavement was dry . 
 The driver of the vehicle was stopped westbound on SE Maple St with intent to turn right, northbound 
onto SE 10
th. Driver was looking right for vehicles, as they pulled forward to make their turn, they 
struck the pedestrian in the crosswalk. Pedestrian was walking north in the crosswal k when they were 
struck by a vehicle attempting to make a turn.  
 
No citations were issued.

2/1/2023 – at around 7:32 p.m. at the private parking lot of Baseline Center, ab out 300 ft south of the 
intersection of NW 18 5th Avenue  and W Baseline Road . 
 
This crash was a vehicle versus vehicle where serious injuries (likely broken ankle) were reported.  
 
Weather was clear and the pavement was dry.  
 A driver was exiting the parking lot and failed to see oncoming vehicle travelling southbound and 
struck this vehicle.

2/13/2023 – at around 5:32 a.m. at the intersection of NE Cornell Road and NE Stucki Avenue.  
 This crash was a vehicle versus pedestrian where serious injuries later resulted in a fatality.  
 Weather was cloudy and the pavement was wet.  
 The driver stated that they were travelling westbound on NE Cornell Road roughly the speed limit of 45 
mph. As they proceeded through the green light,  they struck a pedestrian in the crosswalk.  The driver 
was visibly shaken, stayed on scene and was cooperative.   
 
Pedestrian was found to be wearing a hospital ID tag from Kaiser Westside Hospital.  
 There were no independent witnesses to comment on crash.  
  

 On Feb 15 2023 –  investigating officers learned that the pedestrians blood alcohol level was a 0.402 
which is more than 5 times the legal limit when driving. It is unknown if the pedestrian’s blood alcohol 
level was a factor in the crash. This crash is still under investigation.  
 
Unknown if citation was issued .

3/17/2023 – at around 3:25 p.m. at approximately 100 ft north of the intersection of SE Davis Road and 
SE River Road .  
 Weather was clear and the pavement was dry.  
 Driver claimed that they had experienced a medical emergency and passed o ut. While unconscious. 
The driver drove over a curb, struck a fence,  and went down an embankment. Driver suffered serious 
injuries due to the collision. Several hours later, OHSU reported that driver’s  blood had been tested as 
part of routine medical intak e. Driver’s  blood was 0.17%.   
 Driver cited for DUII and Reckless Driving .

3/17/2023 – at around 8:46 p.m. at approximately 50 ft south of the intersection of SE 10th and SE 
Cedar.  
 This crash was a vehicle versus bicyclist where serious injuries occurred.  
 Weather was clear and the pavement was dry.  
 Pedestrian was in the middle line of SE 10
th trying to cross the street. Driver was driving south, down 
center lane and stuck pedestrian and proceeded to leave the scene. Driver and passenger was late r 
located, passenger confirmed that driver knew that a bicyclist was hit and chose to leave scene. Driver was found to be DUII.  
 Driver was arrested .
